remarks: Once Euclid's Algorithm halts after ` N ` steps, the second element of the state remains 0 .  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2014.)
statement:
eucalgval.1 $e |- E = ( x e. NN0 , y e. NN0 |-> if ( y = 0 , <. x , y >. , <. y , ( x mod y ) >. ) ) $.
eucalg.2 $e |- R = seq 0 ( ( E o. 1st ) , ( NN0 X. { A } ) ) $.
eucalgcvga.3 $e |- N = ( 2nd ` A ) $.
eucalgcvga $p |- ( A e. ( NN0 X. NN0 ) -> ( K e. ( ZZ>= ` N ) -> ( 2nd ` ( R ` K ) ) = 0 ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d N x y $.
$d R x $.
